alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Somerset; Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 25 at 4:52AM EDT until March 26 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...LOW PRESSURE TO BRING ACCUMULATING SNOW AND SOME SLEET TO THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON INTO EARLY SUNDAY... .Snow will overspread the advisory area from this afternoon through the evening from west to east. The snow will be heaviest tonight and may mix with sleet at times. Much of the accumulating snowfall is expected to be finished Sunday morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Some sleet may mix in at times. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches and sleet accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest, west central, and western Maine. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to Noon EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Central Somerset; Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Southern Somerset
